abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the National Emergency
            Transport Rehabilitation Project for Sudan is to facilitate
            the country's economic and social recovery through
            improved physical access to goods, markets, and
            administrative and social services. The changes involve: (i)
            reallocation within and among components to: (a) avail funds
            to institutional development to continue with the capacity
            building activities; (b) provide additional funding to
            supervision services to cover the increased cost of
            supervision, during the extended period of roads contracts
            execution; and (c) utilize the savings from low bid amounts
            to augment the financial provision to the ongoing road
            contracts to cover additional financing (AF) requirements
            due to increase in quantities of existing bill items; (ii)
            dropping activities that would not be implemented under the
            National Emergency Transport Rehabilitation Project
            (NETREP); and (iii) reflecting in project documents the
            cancellation of the allocation for lots A, C, D, and E of
            Kadugli - Kaouda road due to mis-procurement, and (iv)
            extension of the grant closing date by 12 months, from June
            30, 2011 to June 30, 2012, to allow the completion of
            ongoing contracts.
